;全球亿万富翁人数去年减少了 3.5% 至 3,194 人，成为首位一份报告称，自 2018 年以来，中国出现了最大的收缩，该报告称，这些富裕人士持有的总资产在过去十年中出现了第二大年度降幅。

;

;在排名前 15 位的司法管辖区中，拥有世界上最大的亿万富翁人口，仅次于新加坡和俄罗斯。

;

;超级富豪的累计财富下降了 5.5%，至 11.1 万亿美元，原因是飙升的通货膨胀和全球不确定性侵蚀了他们的价值总部位于纽约的 Altrata 使用其 Wealth-X 部门的数据发布的《世界超级财富报告》称，中国拥有仅次于美国的全球第二大亿万富翁人口，在全球超级财富榜上领先数量下降。其亿万富翁人数下降 11% 至 357 人，而他们的财富总值减少 9.3% 至 1.3 万亿美元。

;

;在全球最大的财富集中地名单中，香港与中国分开计算。亿万富翁。据记录，其亿万富翁居民减少了 1.8% 至 112 人，而他们的总财富减少了 7% 至 2670 亿美元。在亿万富翁中心榜单中，这座城市与俄罗斯并列第六，尽管俄罗斯的富豪拥有更多财富，达到 4,790 亿美元。

;

;全球领导者美国的亿万富翁人数下降了 2.1%，至 955 人，他们的财富减少了 5.2%，达到 4.2 万亿美元。报告指出，这一相对温和的下跌意味着世界最大经济体扩大了对中国的领先优势，中国股市下跌、Covid-19 封锁、房地产紧张和经济低迷抑制了估值。

;

;穆克什·安巴尼 (Mukesh Ambani) 是超级富豪之一印度人在新加坡设立家族办公室

;

;“即使按照最近的标准，2022 年也是世界经济波动加剧的一年，从全球流行病到欧洲的新战争，通货膨胀的世代激增中美紧张局势加深和地缘政治秩序重塑，”报告称。

;

;经济指标低迷是他们财富缩水的先兆。

;

;全球经济增长了仅为 3.4%，高通胀率从发达经济体的 7.3% 到新兴和发展中经济体的 9.8% 不等。与此同时，作为全球股市表现晴雨表的 MSCI 世界指数下跌了 18%。另一方面，首次公开发行股票的绝对数量和募集资金均有所下降。

;

;从消费者服务到能源、医疗保健到酒店业，各个领域的亿万富翁的财富都下降了去年至少增加了 5%。

;

;排在美国和中国之后的分别是德国、英国和印度。

;

;通过吸引更多有钱人，这个数字新加坡排名第 13 位的亿万富翁增加了 8%，达到 54 人。他们的总财富也增加了 2.1%，达到 1010 亿美元。

;

;另一方面，俄罗斯却逆势而上，因为其亿万富翁经受住了考验尽管在莫斯科入侵乌克兰后受到制裁，但 2022 年的波动和卢布仍保持其价值。

;

;“虽然俄罗斯的亿万富翁人数在 2022 年增加了 5 人，总数达到 112 人，但他们的总财富增长只是短暂的1%，”Wealth-X 主管 Maya Imberg 说。 “一个国家的发展显然会影响亿万富翁的财富及其数量，但重要的是要记住这个特定人口的规模很小。因此，当总规模较小时，个人的微小变化就会体现在数字上。”

;

;同时，在前 16 位亿万富翁城市中，香港仅次于纽约位居第二。它拥有 112 位亿万富翁，去年失去了两位亿万富翁居民。纽约有 136 位亿万富翁，也比 2021 年减少了两位。中国大陆三个城市也上榜，北京排名第六，深圳排名第九，杭州排名第十二。

;美国对涉嫌参与芬太尼走私的中国实体实施的最新一轮制裁是中国外交部周三表示“不合理”，并警告称此类行动可能会为与华盛顿进一步合作应对危机制造“障碍”。

;

;周二，美国财政部外国资产控制办公室宣布对中国的 7 个实体和 6 个个人以及墨西哥的 1 个实体和 3 个人实施新的制裁。

;

;美国众议院中国小组举行针对黄金时段观众的就职听证会

;

;该部门表示，他们被指控制造和销售压丸机和模具等设备，这些设备用于生产掺有芬太尼的假冒药片并运往美国。

;

;最新举措是在 2018 年实施的类似制裁之后4 月起诉两家中国公司和四名国民涉嫌向墨西哥的贩毒集团提供用于生产芬太尼的前体化学品。

;

;“这些是普通商品，在国内外都不受管制，”外交部发言人毛宁周三表示。 “[T]进口商有责任防止相关设备流入毒品生产渠道。

;

;“如果有人持刀犯罪，持刀者还是制造商都非常清楚她补充说：“使用刀子的人应该受到制裁和惩罚。”该药物每年导致数万人死亡，而且这一数字还在持续上升。

;

;2016 年至 2021 年期间，与芬太尼相关的药物过量致死率几乎翻了两番，从每 100,000 人 5.7 人增至 21.6 人，根据 CDC 本月早些时候发布的一份报告。

;

;美国财政部表示，新制裁的中国公司之一——总部位于深圳的 Yason General Machinery Co——已将设备出售给一家墨西哥供应商，该供应商与锡那罗亚州卡特尔是世界上最大的贩毒组织之一。

;

;该部门还指控位于南部城市惠州的压丸机供应商友力科技发展有限公司使用旨在“逃避法律”的方法运输产品执法审查。”

;

;2019 年之前，中国一直被认为是非法芬太尼进入美国的主要来源。但根据美国国会研究局 2022 年 12 月的一份报告，自当年中国对芬太尼实施管制以来，该药物的生产已大部分转移到墨西哥。

;

;比芬太尼更强大：两种致命药物增加了美国吸毒过量危机

;

;不过，报告补充说，主要材料继续来自中国，美国缉毒局表示，它认为中国贩毒者与墨西哥卡特尔之间的合作有所增加。

;

;“我们仍然致力于利用所有当局打击非法药物生产的推动者，以破坏这种致命的全球生产并应对这些药物构成的威胁，”美国财政部负责恐怖主义和金融情报的副部长布赖恩·尼尔森 (Brian E. Nelson) 说.

;中国南部科技中心深圳市政府计划促进该市的计算随着构建类似 ChatGPT 技术的全球军备竞赛愈演愈烈，深圳有望解决当前的计算资源短缺问题，而计算资源是需要发展的关键基础设施根据市政府周三在其官方微信账号上发布的一项行动计划，通过建立数字平台来协调城市内这些资产的部署和使用，从而训练大型语言模型 (LLM) 等人工智能系统。< /p>;

;“人工智能已成为新一轮科技和产业革命的重要推动力，”深圳市政府的帖子称。 “作为全国首批人工智能创新应用试验区之一，深圳……将努力成为全球人工智能先行城市，为城市高质量发展赋能。”

;

;2019年，中国科技部设立首批国家人工智能试验区。其中包括北京、上海、杭州、合肥、深圳和天津等城市，以及浙江省东部省会杭州附近的德清县。

;

;根据其行动计划，深圳将启动第三阶段该市的鹏城云脑项目——一个支持基础研究和应用的人工智能超级计算设施——将于今年年底建成。

;

;深圳旨在更高效地协调和分配人工智能计算资源的举措反映了中国迫切需要在美国贸易制裁阻碍大陆企业获得最先进的半导体和芯片制造设备的情况下，加速该领域的发展。

;

;中国机构迄今已推出至少 79 个 LLM，参数超过 10 亿，模型的大小和复杂性的度量。 LLM 是 ChatGPT 背后的技术，是一种深度学习算法，可以根据从海量数据集中获得的知识来识别、总结、翻译、预测和生成文本及其他内容。

;

;5 月初，北京市政府政府公布了一项支持中国首都人工智能产业的新政策草案，其中包括为相关公司提供国家资助的计算能力。

;

;ChatGPT 在中国引发投资狂潮和自我反省

;

;深圳的行动计划还将涉及为大湾区建设人工智能超级计算网络，汇聚这个由香港、澳门和广东九市组成的特大城市的政府、企业和研究机构的智能计算能力。

; p>;南部科技城承诺支持人工智能基础模型和芯片等领域的研发，以帮助实现突破。

;

;该市还将积极推动和鼓励人工智能技术在一系列领域的应用。包括公共服务、城市治理和各行各业。根据行动计划，示例包括部署机器人进行街道清扫和检查，采用人工智能进行图像识别和视频分析，以确保消防和建筑施工的安全，根据行动计划。

;

;中国计划建立区域人工智能 '高原及相关技术平台

;

;继美国初创公司 OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 服务取得成功后，中国从国家到城市层面提出了一系列政策，以加大国家在 AI 方面的努力，

;

;中国科技部部长王志刚表示，中国大陆计划在全国建立大量区域性人工智能“高地”和相关技术平台本月早些时候，第七届世界智能大会在北方大都市天津开幕。

;中国敦促地方当局加快收割和烘干受灾小麦在北京越来越重视粮食安全的情况下，努力挽救农作物免受暴雨侵袭。

;

;中国北方（安徽、湖北和陕西部分地区的小麦生产基地所在地）的持续降雨和高湿度导致收获前发芽，也称为发芽损害。小麦也受到枯萎病的感染，这带来了更高的毒素风险并限制了最终用途应用，例如烘焙。

;

;数百万吨未收割的小麦也受到中国中部河南异常强降雨的影响占中国小麦产量四分之一以上的省份。

;

;农业和农村事务部周二晚些时候表示，“尽快收获”，同时还拨打了 24 小时电话热线

;

;中国是世界上最大的小麦消费国和生产国，当局近年来一直在加紧努力，以确保有足够的粮食养活其 14 亿人口，尤其是在全球动荡的情况下以及影响进口的不确定性，包括乌克兰战争。

;

;该部表示，国有粮食储备和地方政府应努力“克服所有挑战”，并收集足够的农作物收割和烘干机，同时确保足够的

;

;该部补充说：“应充分利用公共广场或室外场所的空地来烘干小麦，以防止它们在储备中腐烂。”

;

;警告美国和泰国农民：到 2032 年中国将种植 90% 的粮食

;

;该部还强调了“种子安全”的重要性，以确保腐烂的小麦种子不会影响未来的作物.

;

;“种子安全有待保障。质量不合格的种子不能进入市场，因为这会给秋季种植带来安全风险，”它补充说。

;

;北京东方农业咨询公司高级分析师马文峰估计，在至少有 2000 万吨（448 亿磅）小麦受到大雨的影响。

;

;他还表示，农民面临重大损失，因为受损的小麦将被食品加工公司拒收，最终可能会作为动物饲料。

;

;“我的是真实的”：中国的假冒种子问题如何阻碍创新

;

;马估计去年全国产量的大约 14.5% 已经受到影响。< /p>;

;北京对地方官员施加了政治义务，他们的表现根据耕地面积、粮食产量和作物结构的配额进行评估。

;

;全国小麦产量比去年同期增长了 0.6%政府数据显示，2022 年小麦进口量为 1.377 亿公吨。

;

;与此同时，去年小麦进口量同比增长 1.9% 至 996 万吨。

;中国将派军舰参加本月由印度尼西亚主办的多边海军演习，其中有在亚太地区紧张局势加剧的情况下，还邀请了朝鲜、俄罗斯、韩国和美国等国家。

;

;此次演习正值中国和美国加强该地区的军事外交之际，与盟国和合作伙伴在台湾、南中国海和西太平洋繁忙的航道周围举行更频繁的军事演习。

;

;中国海军将派遣其驱逐舰湛江号和护卫舰许昌号，它们都配备了导弹周三，国防部在一份声明中表示，针对 2023 年科莫多多边海军演习。

;

;去年 12 月，印度尼西亚表示已邀请包括中国在内的 47 个国家的海军参加演习，其中将于 6 月 4 日至 8 日在望加锡举行。这将是自 2014 年第一次以来的第四次此类演习。

;

;上一次科莫多演习发生在 2018 年，当时因 Covid-19 而暂停。中国当时还派出了两艘军舰，即长沙号驱逐舰和柳州号护卫舰，它们都配备了导弹。

;

;上周，中国军方表示计划举行联合演习，演习 Amana Youyi-2023，与东盟地区集团的一些国家，包括柬埔寨、老挝、马来西亚、泰国和越南。

;

;美国、日本和菲律宾本周将在南中国海举行三方海上演习.

;

;中国和美国互相指责对方的军事演习，从中国在台湾附近的军事演习（它认为是一个省）到美国在菲律宾的新基地，都加剧了紧张局势并威胁到和平地区。

;北京表示将对印度的“不公平和歧视性待遇”采取“适当的反制措施”的中国记者，但呼吁采取实际行动，以便恢复“正常的媒体交流”。

;

;这是在《华尔街日报》周二报道称邻国几乎驱逐了彼此的所有记者之后发生的。

;

;该报道称，最近两名在印度的中国记者——来自国家通讯社新华社和国家广播公司中央电视台——被拒绝续签签证。中国外交部周三证实，两名中国驻印度记者未获得签证延期。

;

;该报称，印度不再有任何中国官方媒体记者——这可能是自至少在 1980 年代。

;

;报道还说，在四名驻华印度记者中，有两人没有获得返回中国的签证，其中一人本月被告知其资格已被撤销，但他可以

;

;印度能否在美中太平洋竞争中成为“全球南方冠军”？

;

;“我可以告诉你的是，长期以来，中国媒体记者在印度受到不公平和歧视性待遇，”中国外交部发言人毛宁在例行新闻发布会上被问及驱逐事件时说。

;

;据毛说，印度在 2017 年“无故”缩短了中国记者签证的有效期为一到三个月。她说，在 2020 年，新德里还拒绝批准中国记者永久驻印的申请。

;

;“此外，2021 年 12 月，中国中央广播电视总台的一名驻印度记者——持签证仍然有效两个月，他们的就业仍然有效半年 - 被要求在 10 天内离开该国，”毛说，并补充说新德里尚未对此案作出解释。

;

; “面对印方长期以来的无理打压，中方不得不采取适当反制措施，维护中国媒体的合法权益，”毛泽东说。

;

;中印“脱钩” ' 可能会在有争议的边界激起“不满之夏”

;

;她没有说还有多少印度记者留在中国。但在 4 月——当《印度教报》和国家广播公司 Prasar Bharati 的记者被禁止返回中国时——毛说另外两家印度媒体在该国仍有记者。

;

;毛说北京愿意保持沟通与新德里“本着相互尊重、平等互利的原则”。

;

;

; Wed, 31 May 2023 19:20:01 +0800 ‘How can I ever feel safe?’: India’s Amit Shah faces tall order to restore calm in Manipur after ethnic violencehttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3222429/how-can-i-ever-feel-safe-indias-amit-shah-faces-tall-order-restore-calm-manipur-after-ethnic?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.31 19:00;
;;

;印度内政部长阿米特·沙阿希望恢复秩序，缓解紧张局势曼尼普尔邦经历了数周的种族暴力事件，导致数十人死亡，数万人逃离家园，曼尼普尔邦已前往那里与地区领导人举行会谈。

;

;部落和非部落团体之间的冲突于 5 月爆发3 在法庭上要求大多数 Meitei 社区，他们主要是印度教 - 总理纳伦德拉莫迪政府提倡的宗教 - 被允许获得工作和大学名额，这些社区为主要是基督教徒的部落 Kuki 社区留出。

;

;据信约有 100 人死亡，这促使印度军队进行干预。在暴徒放火烧毁房屋、商店和教堂后，这两个群体的家庭都逃离了。

;

;一些人在军方设立的难民营中寻求安全，而另一些人则完全离开曼尼普尔邦，与邻邦的亲戚住在一起。

;

;由首席部长 N. Biren Singh 领导的曼尼普尔邦政府一直在努力恢复正常状态，警方杀死了至少 40 名他们声称是武装分子的人。

;

;当局不允许解体辛格在周日的一份声明中说，曼尼普尔邦是“武装恐怖分子”袭击的目标。

;

;周末，陆军总司令马诺杰·潘德将军前往该地区，该地区距离德里约 1,600 公里（1,000 英里），那里有数千名士兵军方已部署平息暴力事件。

;

;军方表示，自大屠杀开始以来，军方已将大约 35,000 人疏散到安全地带。

;

;军队继续在街上巡逻，宵禁仍然存在，互联网仍然中断。飞往曼尼普尔邦的航班已无限期取消，媒体也被禁止前往那里。

;

;自暴力事件开始以来，沙阿首次访问曼尼普尔邦时，他面临的最大挑战是修复 Kukis 之间信任的大规模破裂和迈特人。 Kukis 说，由 Meitei 主导的州政府一直在参与暴力、纵火和袭击他们的礼拜场所。他们声称，在过去的一个月里，大约 200 座教堂被纵火。

;

;长期的暴力事件有效地分裂了曼尼普尔邦。在人口大量流离失所的情况下，久喜人从名亭地区逃离到久喜地区以获得安全感，反之亦然。这两个社区几乎完全分开。感情上的鸿沟似乎无法逾越。

;

;“我们再也不能同居了。逃离州首府英帕尔前往邻国米佐拉姆邦与亲戚团聚的库基妇女金瓦特说。 ”英帕尔的 Meitei 人 Kanhai Singh 说。

;

;冲突源于古老的断层线。梅泰人占多数，他们大多居住在英帕尔的山谷中，而库基斯人是一个生活在城市周围郁郁葱葱的山丘中的部落。 Kukis 与另一个部落 Nagas 一起占该州 350 万人口的大约 40%。

;

;二十年来，Meitei 一直要求获得“表列部落”的地位，这将使他们有资格获得政府职位和大学的保留配额。

;

;Kukis 反对这一要求。他们争辩说，明帝已经占多数，更富裕、受教育程度更高，而且政治上更强大，因为他们控制着政府。在州议会的 60 个席位中，40 个代表山谷，只有 20 个代表山丘——这也是 Kukis 感到被边缘化的原因之一。

;

;曼尼普尔邦在发展方面落后于印度大部分地区，政府工作岗位也很少

;

;最近几周的愤怒凸显了总理纳伦德拉·莫迪政府面临的挑战，尤其是在他寻求在明年举行的全国大选中连任第三个任期之际。

;< p>;“你可以看到所有投资都去了哪里，”Kuki 大学讲师 Debory Fimsangpui 说，她在 Imphal 的家被暴徒烧毁。

;

;尽管如此，她认为自己很幸运。她碰巧带儿子离开城市去度假，她相信如果他们当时在家，他们就不会活到今天。

;

;“英帕尔拥有所有的办公室、商场、教育机构和医院。我们都来因帕尔求医，并把我们的孩子送到这里接受教育，因为这里的设施比山区更好，”她补充说。

;

;虽然紧张局势已经酝酿了一段时间，但暴徒的导火索暴力和纵火是曼尼普尔邦高等法院 4 月份下达的命令，敦促州政府推进批准 Meitei 部落地位的要求。

;

;愤怒的 Kukis 示威反对该命令，暴力事件迅速席卷该邦，因其湖泊和森林覆盖的山丘而成为一个受欢迎的旅游胜地。

;

;报告显示，大多数受害者是 Kukis，但 Meitei 人也成为目标。由于没有飞往曼尼普尔邦的航班，媒体也无法访问，因此无法核实所有竞争对手的说法。

;

;由于没有可靠的信息来源，谣言和理论四处流传，加深了双方的不信任，

;

;周一，内政部长沙阿 (Shah) 会见了政治家和官员，这是他对曼尼普尔邦为期三天访问的第一天。他的到来恰逢新的暴力事件爆发。

;

;该州首席部长辛格被库基斯指责对他们有偏见，他在沙阿到来时说，40 名库基“恐怖分子”已被警察打死最近的冲突。

;

;“我们不是恐怖分子。我们只是想保卫自己免受美帝的种族清洗。他们称我们为非法移民和罂粟种植者。现在我们是恐怖分子。我们想知道接下来他们会怎么称呼我们，”Churachandpur 的公务员 Kapsuanlian Tungnung 说。

;

;在新德里，许多家庭已经逃到安全的地方，泪流满面的 Kuki 妇女周一举行了抗议活动，要求新德里管理国家，因为他们对由 Meitei 主导的州政府没有信心。

;

;Chong（只有一个名字）就是其中之一，她说她的 Meitei 邻居在看到暴徒焚烧时在她位于因帕尔的房子里。 “他们没有采取任何措施来阻止暴徒。他们看着我失去了所有的财产、文件和证书。如果那是他们对我的仇恨，我和我的家人怎么能和他们一起生活感到安全呢？”她问道。

;

;一些 Kukis 指责 Meitei 已经成为“激进的印度教徒”，以“消灭”基督教 Kukis。

;

;“有一种理论认为印度民族主义者 Bharatiya人民党 (BJP) 在新德里执政，这些身穿黑色 T 恤并高喊分裂宗教口号的团体正在制造社区冲突。随着印度人民党 2017 年在曼尼普尔邦赢得权力，人们相信他们变得更加大胆，”研究学者 Suanmualian Tonsing 说，他从美国返回印度研究家乡的冲突，但一直滞留在新德里，等待恢复航班。

;

;目前尚不清楚信任破裂是否可以修复。 “我认识几代在山区从事政府工作的 Meitei。他们无法相信库奇家族，在过去几十年之后，竟然对他们产生了如此大的仇恨。恢复现状是不可能的，”一位不愿透露姓名的当地记者说。

;

;库基立法者要求独立政府，因为在经历了如此多的流血事件之后，与明廷一起生活是他们在 5 月 13 日的一份声明中说：“对我们的人民来说，生不如死”。随着 Kukis 继续感到恐惧，这种需求越来越强烈，而辛格政府几乎没有采取任何措施来消除这种恐惧。

;

;一个小例子是Tonsing的旅行计划。一旦航班恢复，他将不会像往常一样从德里飞往英帕尔，然后再开车 40 分钟，返回位于兰卡区的家乡。

;

;再见莫迪？执政的印度人民党在印度主要邦投下了反对票

;

;他表示，他宁愿飞往邻近的米佐拉姆邦，开车 10 小时才能到达目的地。他补充说：“飞往英帕尔机场的想法太令人不安和冒险了。”

;

;自抵达曼尼普尔邦以来，沙阿没有发表任何评论。他将如何回应要求单独成立 Kuki 政府的要求尚不得而知，但不太可能是有利的。双方都在等着看他在看不到解决办法的情况下提出什么解决办法。

;

;Bloomberg 补充报道

; Wed, 31 May 2023 19:20:01 +0800 German court jails ‘militant far-left’ extremists for neo-Nazi attackshttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/europe/article/3222475/german-court-jails-militant-far-left-extremists-neo-nazi-attacks?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.31 19:05;
;;

;A German court on Wednesday sentenced a left-wing extremist woman to more than five years in jail for attacking neo-Nazis and other alt-right radicals.

;

;The principal defendant, identified only as Lina E., and three other suspects were convicted for taking part in a “criminal organisation” that carried out several assaults against right-wing extremists between 2018 and 2020.

;

;In their closing argument, prosecutors had argued that there “is no good political violence” and had sought eight years in prison for Lina E.

;

;The defence had urged the judge to acquit the accused, saying that the prosecution had based its case mainly on the statements of a key witness who was a former member of the group and who is currently in a witness protection programme.< /p>;

;Prosecutors said the group planned the attacks intensively, including by spying on their victims.

;

;In one attack in October 2018, the group's members kicked and beat a right-wing extremist in the eastern town of Wurzen, leaving him with serious injuries.

;

;In October 2019, they carried out an assault on the owner and several customers of a restaurant popular with neo-Nazis in the central town of Eisenach.

;

;The owner and several people accompanying him were also assaulted two months later on the streets.

;

;The four defendants shared a “militant far-left ideology”, said prosecutors.

;

;E. and her partner Johann G. – who is still at large – are believed to be ringleaders of the group.

;

;The trial, which lasted a year and a half, was held under tight security.

;

;Ahead of the verdict, police were bracing for far-left violence as the radical scene has threatened “a million (euros) worth of property damage across the country” for every year of imprisonment handed down by the court.

;

;Far-left activists have also called a demonstration in Leipzig on Saturday.

; Wed, 31 May 2023 19:20:01 +0800 China facing ‘more complex’ security challenges, President Xi Jinping says, warns of ‘worst-case’ situationhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/politics/article/3222477/china-facing-more-complex-security-challenges-president-xi-jinping-says-warns-worst-case-situation?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.31 19:14;
;;

;China is facing more complex and difficult national security concerns, President Xi Jinping warned on Tuesday, urging speedy modernisation of safeguards as he reiterated his call for officials to be prepared for “perilous storms” ahead.

;

;His comments showed China harboured no “illusions” about the possible damaging effects of its rivalry with the US, and had little hope of a lasting improvement in ties, analysts said.

;

;The remarks from Xi came as he chaired a meeting of the National Security Commission, his first since securing an unprecedented third term as leader of China's ruling Communist Party at its 20th congress in October. Xi heads both the commission and the Chinese military.

;

;He said the country's security apparatus needed to stay “keenly aware” of the complicated and challenging circumstances facing national security, and correctly grasp major related issues, according to state news agency Xinhua.

;

;The national security issues facing China were “considerably more complex and much more difficult” to deal with, Xinhua reported Xi as saying, as he urged officials to be ready to deal with “worst-case and most extreme scenarios”, so that they could withstand “high winds and waves and even perilous storms”.

;

;China plans to set up regional AI 'highlands' and related tech platforms

;

;Xi's remarks come as rival powers China and the United States continue to lock horns on many fronts. Both sides have stepped up national security scrutiny, especially in the technology sector, with the US slapping sanctions on a slew of Chinese companies in the past few years citing security concerns.

;

;In March, in a rare public comment on the US tech rivalry, Xi directly named Washington for leading the Western suppression of China.

;

;China recently prohibited its key infrastructure operators from buying products made by US memory chip maker Micron Technology, citing “relatively serious” cybersecurity risks. Chinese security officials have also carried out raids on a few foreign and local consultancy and business intelligence firms.

;

;Minutes from Tuesday's meeting published by Xinhua said China needed to speed up the modernisation of the national security system and capabilities, to make sure they were practical and effective. The country's security apparatus was urged to improve oversight of internet data and artificial intelligence, according to the readout.

;

;The meeting also approved the speedy implementation of a nationwide security risk monitoring and early warning system, and stronger public education on national security.

;

;National security was a major part of Xi's work report opening the 20th party congress in October, when he vowed to strengthen safeguards in key sectors including the economy, major infrastructure, finance and telecoms networks, as well as improve data, biological, resources, nuclear, space and maritime security.

;

;Xi had also sounded a warning then about choppy waters and “dangerous storms” ahead, as he highlighted the challenges and risks facing the country.

;

;According to Xie Maosong, senior fellow at Beijing's Taihe Institute and a senior researcher at Tsinghua University's National Strategy Institute, said Xi's latest remarks showed China had “no rosy illusions” about the potentially devastating outcome of the US rivalry and was making serious efforts to prepare for it.

;

;“The 'worst-case scenarios' might include a nuclear war, a devastating war that ruins China's coastal economic belts [or] Western sanctions on China's energy, finance and food supply,” Xie said.

;

;“The better China is prepared for these, the less likely such scenarios will actually happen.”

;

;Other likely challenges could be “a new pandemic” or “a major earthquake and other disasters caused by extreme weathers”, he added.

;

;Alfred Wu, an associate professor at the National University of Singapore's Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy, said Xi's remarks meant Beijing was convinced that recent minor improvements in Sino-US relations would be short-lived.

;

;“Xi has named the US as the culprit behind China's problems,” Wu said.

;

;“Some mainland scholars have also openly expressed pessimism about the Sino-US relationship, saying the deterioration was due to domestic political dynamics in China and the US. No matter how many dialogues, there will be no fundamental improvement [they have said]. I think it is a very honest assessment.”

;

;In a sign of the importance accorded to security work, the commission meeting was attended by three members of the Politburo Standing Committee, the party's core leadership line-up.

;

;They were Premier Li Qiang, Zhao Leji – chairman of China's top legislative body, and Xi's chief of staff Cai Qi, according to Xinhua.

;

;Xinhua did not provide details of the role of Cai, whose formal title is director of the General Office of the party's Central Committee, in the new commission line-up decided at the October congress.

;

;But Xie said Cai's presence might indicate he had taken over as the chief of the commission's general office from his chief of staff predecessor Ding Xuexiang, according to past convention.

;

;Ding, who is also a Politburo Standing Committee member, now serves as an executive vice-premier.

;

;Xi proposed the setting up of the National Security Commission in 2013 and has headed it since its inception.

;

;Its meetings are usually attended by the heads of a wide range of government and party bodies for discussions on domestic and foreign security challenges, including sovereignty issues, security, development interests, political security, social stability, and cyber and biosecurity matters.

;

;Cai is no stranger to the commission. He was transferred to Beijing to work as the deputy chief of its general office in March 2014, two months after the party leadership finalised the initial line-up of the powerful agency tasked with streamlining national security coordination across various ministries.

; Wed, 31 May 2023 19:20:01 +0800 Hong Kong busker arrested while playing protest song cleared of Covid-19 social-distancing offencehttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-and-crime/article/3222478/hong-kong-busker-arrested-while-playing-protest-song-cleared-covid-19-social-distancing-offence?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.31 19:15;
;;

;A busker arrested by police after playing the anti-government tune “Glory to Hong Kong” has been acquitted of a Covid-19 social-distancing offence, as a court ruled the prosecution's evidence was too “subjective and vague” to support a conviction.

;

;But Oliver Ma Fu-chi said after Wednesday's ruling that he might no longer perform the song widely regarded as the unofficial anthem for the 2019 anti-government movement.

;

;“Would I be performing the song again? At this time, probably not,” Ma told reporters outside Eastern Court. “But it was really nice to have had a chance to sing it.”

;

;The 23-year-old was arrested in May 2021 after officers received a noise complaint from a junction in Central near the Lan Kwai Fong entertainment district, but was released without charge in November last year.

;

;Police instead filed a summons accusing him of organising a public gathering exceeding a limit of four people under a now-defunct Prevention and Control of Disease (Prohibition on Gathering) Regulation enacted during the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020.

;

;A police constable said during the trial that he had seen Ma playing music that night in front of about 30 to 40 people, who applauded and videotaped his performances.

;

;Video footage played in court showed Ma performing the anti-government song, with police warning that he might have violated Hong Kong law and disrupted public order.

;

;Hong Kong police arrest man for playing protest song near British consulate

;

;The song, written during the 2019 protests against a now-withdrawn extradition bill, appealed to people to “Liberate Hong Kong” in a “revolution of our times”.

;

;The officer said he arrested Ma because he felt the busker had inflamed people's emotions.

;

;But the witness was unable to confirm details about the alleged incident, including a rough estimate of the distance between spectators.

;

;During the cross-examination, he said he was unsure whether anyone was taping the defendant's performances when other police officers arrived at the scene.

;

;Hong Kong protests: city leader refuses to set deadline for closing police inquiries

;

;Magistrate Minnie Wat Lai-man on Wednesday said Ma had drawn suspicion upon himself, as he failed to produce any permit for playing musical instruments in public and ignored the police warnings.

;

;But Wat found a reasonable doubt regarding the accuracy of the constable's observations.

;

;“The court has doubts as to whether [the officer]'s evidence was reliable as he appeared to have a rather uncertain recollection of what happened at the material time,” she said.

;

;Hong Kong protest song still No 1 in some Google search rankings overseas

;

;Ma said after the ruling that he only played the protest song in defence when police “interrogated” him in the past. He added he had stopped performing the tune regularly after the protests died down.

;

;Ma is not the only street performer who landed himself in court after playing the song.

;

;Erhu player Li Jiexin, 69, was charged in three cases over his cover of the anti-government tune in public in 2021 and 2022. He was acquitted in one case but is still undergoing trial in the other proceedings.

;

;The legality of “Glory to Hong Kong” took centre stage during the first trial under the National Anthem Ordinance, which concerned a remix video showing a city athlete being presented with an Olympic gold medal against the backdrop of the protest song.

;

;The same magistrate is expected to deliver her ruling in that case on Thursday.

; Wed, 31 May 2023 19:20:01 +0800 Beijing rejects Taiwan presidential candidate’s ‘bizarre’ wish to have dinner and talk peace with Xihttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/politics/article/3222464/beijing-rejects-taiwan-presidential-candidates-bizarre-wish-have-dinner-and-talk-peace-xi?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.31 19:18;
;;

;Beijing has rejected as “bizarre” and “deceitful” a suggestion by Taiwanese presidential hopeful William Lai Ching-te that he would like to dine with Chinese President Xi Jinping to talk about peace.

;

;“Isn't it bizarre for someone who has labelled himself as a 'pragmatic Taiwan independence worker' to say something like that?” Zhu Fenglian, a spokeswoman for the mainland's Taiwan Affairs Council, said on Wednesday.

;

;Lai – the incumbent vice-president who is running for president in January as the ruling Democratic Progressive Party's candidate – told a group of students in Taipei on Sunday that of all global leaders he would most like to have dinner with Xi.

;

;Beijing, which claims sovereignty over Taiwan, has vowed to attack the island if it ever declares formal independence from the mainland. It has also said that it is willing to hold peace dialogue with any party from Taiwan as long as they ditch their pro-independence stand.

;

;Speaking at a news conference in Beijing, Zhu said Lai's suggestion was “deceitful” if he was not prepared to change his pro-independence view.

;

;She said peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait and the region would only be maintained, and the well-being of the two sides achieved, when the island abandoned its stand on independence.

;

;“Obstinately insisting on the pro-independence splittist stance is ignoring the hopes and interests of the Taiwanese public and will only push Taiwan to the brink of war,” she said, adding that peaceful cross-strait ties could only be attained when that stance was abandoned.

;

;Who will win Taiwan's crucial 2024 election?

;

;As a front runner in the initial three-party race that also includes Hou Yu-ih, New Taipei mayor from the main opposition Kuomintang, and Ko Wen-je, head of the Taiwan People's Party, Lai has long been known for his independence-leaning position.

;

;During his stint as premier in 2017, he openly admitted in a legislature meeting that he was a “pragmatic Taiwan independence worker”, though in recent years he has toned down his rhetoric in a bid to win support from neutral voters and the United States – Taiwan's informal but close ally. The US, like most countries, does not see Taiwan as a sovereign state but is opposed to any forcible change to the cross-strait status quo.

;

;Answering questions from students at his alma mater, National Chengchi University, in Taipei on Sunday, Lai said he would most like to have dinner with Xi because he wanted to tell him to “chill out a little and not put everyone under so much pressure”.

;

;“People's well-being is the most important thing and peace benefits everyone,” he said.

;

;Taiwan's Tsai Ing-wen vows to maintain cross-strait status quo

;

;When asked for her comment on Lai's dinner remarks, Beijing's foreign ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning told a press conference on Tuesday that Taiwan was part of China and did not have a so-called vice-president.

;

;“This is not about foreign affairs and I have no comment. If the DPP authorities really care about peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, the key lies in upholding the one-China principle,” she said.
